definition: lit. to present oneself confidently to the emperor, without makeup (as did the sister of Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1]) (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) to show one's natural features, without makeup/to present oneself just as one is, without artifice
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards

sentences.english: You are facing the day you smile.
sentences.chinese: 你素面朝天你笑靨如花。

definition: to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup
messy hair and dirty face/bad appearance
not care about one's appearance (idiom)/slovenly in dress and manner
to decorate/to dress/to make up/to adorn/manner of dressing/style of dress
variant of 裝扮|装扮[zhuang1 ban4]
simple and neat/quiet (colors)/unobtrusive/(of food) light/not greasy or strongly flavored
face powder and eyebrow liner/cosmetics/(fig.) beautiful woman
